verses.kjv: And it came to pass in the days of Amraphel king of Shinar, Arioch king of Ellasar, Chedorlaomer king of Elam, and Tidal king of nations;
verses.ct: During the time of Amraphel king of Shinar, Arioch king of Ellasar, Chedorlaomer king of Elam, and Tidal king of nations,

verses.kjv: That these made war with Bera king of Sodom, and with Birsha king of Gomorrah, Shinab king of Admah, and Shemeber king of Zeboiim, and the king of Bela, which is Zoar.
verses.ct: these kings went to war against Bera king of Sodom, Birsha king of Gomorrah, Shinab king of Admah, Shemeber king of Zeboiim, and the king of Bela (also known as Zoar).

verses.kjv: All these were joined together in the vale of Siddim, which is the salt sea.
verses.ct: All the latter kings formed an alliance in the Valley of Siddim, which is now the Salt Sea.

verses.kjv: Twelve years they served Chedorlaomer, and in the thirteenth year they rebelled.
verses.ct: They had been subject to Chedorlaomer for 12 years, but in the 13th year they revolted.

verses.kjv: And in the fourteenth year came Chedorlaomer, and the kings that were with him, and smote the Rephaims in Ashteroth Karnaim, and the Zuzims in Ham, and the Emims in Shaveh Kiriathaim,
verses.ct: In the 14th year, Chedorlaomer and the kings allied with him attacked and defeated the Rephaims in Ashteroth Karnaim, the Zuzims in Ham, and the Emims in Shaveh Kiriathaim,

verses.kjv: And the Horites in their mount Seir, unto Elparan, which is by the wilderness.
verses.ct: as well as the Horites in their hill country of Seir, driving them all the way to Elparan, near the edge of the wilderness.

verses.kjv: And they returned, and came to Enmishpat, which is Kadesh, and smote all the country of the Amalekites, and also the Amorites, that dwelt in Hazezontamar.
verses.ct: Then they turned back and came to Enmishpat (which is Kadesh), where they conquered the entire territory of the Amalekites and also defeated the Amorites living in Hazezontamar.

verses.kjv: And there went out the king of Sodom, and the king of Gomorrah, and the king of Admah, and the king of Zeboiim, and the king of Bela (the same is Zoar;) and they joined battle with them in the vale of Siddim;
verses.ct: Then the king of Sodom, the king of Gomorrah, the king of Admah, the king of Zeboiim, and the king of Bela (that is, Zoar) marched out and engaged them in battle in the Valley of Siddim—

verses.kjv: With Chedorlaomer the king of Elam, and with Tidal king of nations, and Amraphel king of Shinar, and Arioch king of Ellasar; four kings with five.
verses.ct: against Chedorlaomer king of Elam, Tidal king of nations, Amraphel king of Shinar, and Arioch king of Ellasar—4 kings fighting against 5.

verses.kjv: And the vale of Siddim was full of slimepits; and the kings of Sodom and Gomorrah fled, and fell there; and they that remained fled to the mountain.
verses.ct: Now the Valley of Siddim was covered with tar pits, and when the kings of Sodom and Gomorrah tried to retreat, they fell into them. The survivors escaped to the mountains.

verses.kjv: And they took all the goods of Sodom and Gomorrah, and all their victuals, and went their way.
verses.ct: The victorious kings seized all the possessions and food from Sodom and Gomorrah and left.

verses.kjv: And they took Lot, Abram’s brother’s son, who dwelt in Sodom, and his goods, and departed.
verses.ct: They also captured Lot, Abram's nephew, who was living in Sodom, along with everything he owned.

verses.kjv: And there came one that had escaped, and told Abram the Hebrew; for he dwelt in the plain of Mamre the Amorite, brother of Eshcol, and brother of Aner: and these were confederate with Abram.
verses.ct: One person who escaped came and reported this to Abram the Hebrew. Abram was living near the oak trees of Mamre the Amorite, who was the brother of Eshcol and Aner. These men had a treaty with Abram.

verses.kjv: And when Abram heard that his brother was taken captive, he armed his trained servants, born in his own house, three hundred and eighteen, and pursued them unto Dan.
verses.ct: When Abram learned that his nephew had been taken captive, he mobilized 318 trained fighters who had been born in his household and chased the invaders all the way to Dan.

verses.kjv: And he divided himself against them, he and his servants, by night, and smote them, and pursued them unto Hobah, which is on the left hand of Damascus.
verses.ct: During the night, he split his forces and launched an attack against them, defeating them and pursuing them as far as Hobah, which is north of Damascus.

verses.kjv: And he brought back all the goods, and also brought again his brother Lot, and his goods, and the women also, and the people.
verses.ct: He recovered all the stolen possessions, and he also brought back his nephew Lot with his belongings, along with the women and the rest of the people.

verses.kjv: And the king of Sodom went out to meet him after his return from the slaughter of Chedorlaomer, and of the kings that were with him, at the valley of Shaveh, which is the king’s dale.
verses.ct: After Abram returned from his victory over Chedorlaomer and the kings allied with him, the king of Sodom came out to meet him in the Valley of Shaveh (also called the King's Valley).

verses.kjv: And Melchizedek king of Salem brought forth bread and wine: and he was the priest of the most high God.
verses.ct: Then Melchizedek, king of Salem, brought out bread and wine. He served as a priest of God Most High.

verses.kjv: And he blessed him, and said, Blessed be Abram of the most high God, possessor of heaven and earth:
verses.ct: He blessed Abram and said, 'May Abram be blessed by God Most High, the maker of heaven and earth.

verses.kjv: And blessed be the most high God, which hath delivered thine enemies into thy hand. And he gave him tithes of all.
verses.ct: And praise to God Most High, who gave you victory over your enemies.' Then Abram gave Melchizedek a tenth of everything.

verses.kjv: And the king of Sodom said unto Abram, Give me the persons, and take the goods to thyself.
verses.ct: The king of Sodom said to Abram, 'Just return the people to me, and keep all the possessions for yourself.'

verses.kjv: And Abram said to the king of Sodom, I have lift up mine hand unto the LORD, the most high God, the possessor of heaven and earth,
verses.ct: But Abram replied to the king of Sodom, 'I have made a solemn oath to the LORD, God Most High, the maker of heaven and earth,

verses.kjv: That I will not take from a thread even to a shoelatchet, and that I will not take any thing that is thine, lest thou shouldest say, I have made Abram rich:
verses.ct: that I will not accept so much as a thread or a sandal strap—nothing at all that belongs to you—so that you can never claim, "I made Abram wealthy."

verses.kjv: Save only that which the young men have eaten, and the portion of the men which went with me, Aner, Eshcol, and Mamre; let them take their portion.
verses.ct: The only exception is what my young men have already eaten, and the fair share owed to the men who went with me—Aner, Eshcol, and Mamre. Let them receive their portion.'
